div.ab: light, pull out the hairs which make the tip too long with the ends of your fingernails, and this until the tip seems good to you, & until you notice in it the rat hairs which are entirely black & the hair of the petit-gris is at the whitish from the root to the middle. When it pleases you, bind b and tighten it very well with a thread in two places, then cut the excess & fit it in a quill of a convenient thickness for it, of a duck or a crow for the small ones. Good paintbrushes are those that, once dipped in water, do not bulge when you trace on your hand.
